name: Martha Liliana Rodríguez Romo
title: Public Relations Specialist

summary.text: I am a Public Relations professional focused on social aid in Colombia. I founded Cambiando Vidas LR SAS, leading initiatives to support vulnerable elderly adults and empowered women. I have worked on human rights projects, environmental conservation, and support for vulnerable animals. With experience in orchidology and solar panel commercialization, I am committed to social development and sustainability.

responsibilities: Responsible for human connections and the articulation of national and international efforts for the protection and promotion of human rights.
Leadership in the formulation and validation of the organization's Statutes, establishing principles of governance, strategic control, and institutional responsibility.
Coordination of diplomatic and political advocacy before international human rights systems, including participation in multilateral forums and drafting official reports and communications.
Supervision of national management, ensuring strategic alignment with the institutional mission and promoting transparency, integrity, and effective articulation of the governing bodies.
Facilitating relationships with multilateral organizations, partners, and strategic allies for the international projection of the organization and the consolidation of its operational structure.

Management and implementation of an international alliance with the ABILITYTOHELP organization, through which 15,000 English language training scholarships (A1 to B1 levels) were distributed, as well as scholarships for technical studies in Applied Human Behavior, benefiting vulnerable youth and adults.

Appointed Doctor Honoris Causa in Human Rights during the First International Summit of the Colombian Bar Association (June 2025, Cartagena), in recognition of her trajectory in social leadership, promotion of rights, and contributions to strengthening justice and advocacy at an international level.

Facilitating strategic processes for the positioning of companies, organizations, and individuals in national and international markets, promoting visibility and strengthening their brands in direct collaboration with Construcción, Servicio, Paz y Justicia en América Latina, SERPAJ, and the World Press Agency.

Developing training, capacity building, and entrepreneurial support programs, especially aimed at Afro-descendant and indigenous women, with direct impact on more than 800 families in the Cesar department through joint work with the 'Mecedora de mis Ancestros' organization.
Coordinating a national network of producers to optimize the commercialization of their products, strengthen their ventures, and position Colombian farmers in national and international markets.

Promoting innovative cultural initiatives that integrate art and local identity, generating impact on participating communities and strengthening their connection with national culture through a cultural alliance with Maestro Siaucho.

Leading 'Sembrando Semillas', a Cambiando Vidas LR S.A.S project that impacted more than 1,500 clients through the sale of orchid seeds, formalizing more than 300 nurseries, and working directly with 400 farmers to foster sustainable development in the sector.
Facilitating access to human rights training, literacy, and free events for vulnerable elderly adults, raising funds for the Colombia Mayor program.
Collaborating with the 'Veeduría por una Colombia Honesta' alongside Leonardo Bernal Caballero, working on the promotion and defense of human rights at a national level.
Coordinating the training and follow-up of more than 200 women in Magdalena and Cundinamarca, empowering them through the FMEC Foundation.

Organizing events in Bogotá, with the PROASOCIADOS foundation connecting international investors with national entrepreneurs, enabling more than 200 entrepreneurs to formalize and scale their businesses.
Connecting students from remote territories with the TLS Foundation, facilitating their access to scholarships from the Georgia Tech International Corporation for their university degrees.
Providing training to people with disabilities, through the alliance with the Latin American movement of people with disabilities, to facilitate their integration into society.
Training victims of the armed conflict about their rights and providing continuous support.
Coordinating the management and submission of projects in Cundinamarca and Antioquia with Dismartek, fulfilling all established requirements and deadlines.

Being part of the Great Network of Antioquia through AppAntioquia, and collaborating in the Popular Association and the Departmental Media Table. Contributing to the Antioquia Federation of Arts and the United Artists Association (NIT 90027942-5), united with the National Creative Industry led jointly by James Arboleda and myself.
Supporting the protection of vulnerable animals in Cundinamarca, financing social initiatives through Inverfina SAC, a Peruvian construction company, for the past 10 years.

Contributing to environmental conservation in Colombia, Peru, and Ecuador, leading expeditions in the Amazon to identify and preserve endemic species for 8 years. Achieved the creation of new hybridizations that strengthen biodiversity and support conservation efforts.
Supporting the community of Nueva Jerusalen in Ibagué in conjunction with Mrs. Flora Imelda Perez, President of the communal action board.
Supporting in conjunction with the FEDISCOL organization people with disabilities in Colombian territory.
Working hand in hand with the national federation of displaced persons in defense of human rights, ANDEDH.
Promoted the commercialization and implementation of solar panels nationwide, achieving successful adoption in 5 cities.
Started 12 years ago in the human settlement Pachacutec in Lima, Peru, providing support to children and street animals through the "Construyendo Sonrisas" project.
Collaborated with fine arts artists in Lima, boosting the local economy through the promotion and commercialization of their works.
Organized workshops for recycling wood from demolished houses, focused on environmental rehabilitation and supporting 10 young people with drug addiction problems.
Directed the "Suma_rte" gallery in Peru, highlighting the importance of 'guacas' (ancient burial sites) and other traditional spaces through rock paintings and semi-precious stones.
Succeeded in supporting more than 70 homeless animals in the past and currently cares for 18 dogs, providing them with medical care, food, and a safe home.

education: Diploma in Human Rights with the World Peace Armed Chaplaincy of Mexico.
Human Rights, National School of Community Training.
Diploma in Circle of Masters Knowledge and Wisdom of the Federation of Disability Caregivers of Colombia and the Disruptive Guajira Movement.
certifications: High Distinction «Honor, Dignity and Glory» Adolfo Pérez Esquivel 2024 in Commemoration of Universal Human Rights Day.
Doctor Honoris Causa in: Human Rights.
